oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Skip Ewing Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Skip Ewing (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Skip Ewing; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Skip Ewing talks about blocking out times to write and writing "Burnin' a Hole in My Heart" in his truck -- (01:30) Ewing talks about his discussion to name the album "The Coast of Colorado" and writing "Lighter Shade of Blue" with Max T. Barnes and Troy Seals -- (04:05) Ewing comments on Seals and gaining acceptance from writers he respects -- (05:33) Ewing talks about the continental divide - (05:47) Biff Collie inquires about "I Don't Have Far to Fall," Ewing reflects on his own writings, and Ewing discusses the honor he feels to have his songs re-recorded -- (06:44) Ewing reflects on his writing friend Barnes -- (07:18) Collie and Ewing discuss the writing styles of Barnes -- (07:50) Ewing recalls his divorce coinciding with cutting Ewing's album and writing "Autumn's Not That Cold" in the IHOP with Barnes -- (10:00) Ewing talks about finishing "Autumn's Not That Cold" and staying up all night wanting to show people his track -- (10:56) Ewing talks about preferring to use his own experiences to write songs but is willing to take other's stories -- (11:50) Ewing talks about "The Coast of Colorado" and living in Colorado in junior high -- (12:34) Ewing tells how "The Coast of Colorado" was created to describe a feeling more than a literal interpretation and jabbed at Barnes -- (14:50) Ewing talks about the genius of simplicity in writing; Merle Haggard demonstrates this value for Ewing -- (15:56) Ewing and Collie joke about writers -- (16:08) Ewing talks about his song "Don't Mind If I Do" and how he found the inspiration; additionally, Ewing tells about disturbing Don Sampson to write the song -- (18:03) Ewing talks about George Strait -- (18:40) Ewing discusses Sampson's inspiration for "The Gospel According to Luke" -- (19:16) Collie and Ewing talk about growing up and diversity in Ewing's work -- (20:56) Collie and Ewing discuss Ewing's future living decisions -- (21:53) Ewing talks about making himself write and writing all night when inspiration hits -- (24:30) Ewing recalls talking with a Michael White -- (25:15) Ewing thanks Collie and vise versa -- (25:20) Ewing talks about the time required in order to record an album and the process of recording -- (26:17) Ewing says goodbye radio spot for the Music City Album Review
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Ewing, Skip; Collie, Biff;
